quality_assessment: Page does not exist - this is a critical gap in documentation structure

issues.description: The mapreduce/overview.md file does not exist in the documentation. This is the primary entry point for understanding MapReduce workflows and should provide a high-level overview of the feature.
issues.fix_suggestion: Create docs/mapreduce/overview.md with comprehensive overview of MapReduce workflows covering: 1) What MapReduce mode is and when to use it, 2) High-level explanation of the three phases (setup, map, reduce), 3) Key concepts like work distribution and parallel execution, 4) Simple introductory example, 5) Links to detailed pages for each topic

issues.description: No introductory content explaining what MapReduce workflows are and when to use them
issues.fix_suggestion: Add introduction section explaining: 'MapReduce workflows enable parallel processing of large datasets by distributing work items across isolated agents. Use MapReduce when you need to process many items concurrently (e.g., bulk code changes, data migrations, or analysis tasks).'

issues.description: No explanation of the three MapReduce phases and their purposes
issues.fix_suggestion: Add section documenting the three phases: 1) Setup - Optional initialization phase for preparing work items (features.json lines 16-24), 2) Map - Parallel processing across isolated agents (lines 25-35), 3) Reduce - Aggregation of results (lines 36-44). Include simple diagram showing flow from setup → map (parallel) → reduce.

issues.description: No introductory example showing simple MapReduce workflow structure
issues.fix_suggestion: Add basic YAML example showing minimal MapReduce workflow structure with all three phases, demonstrating: input file with work items, simple agent_template processing each item, reduce phase aggregating results. Keep example simple and well-commented.

issues.description: No explanation of what work items are and how they're processed
issues.fix_suggestion: Add section explaining: 'Work items are individual units of work distributed to parallel agents. They're extracted from JSON files using JSONPath expressions and can be filtered, sorted, and deduplicated before processing.' Reference the work-distribution.md page for details.

issues.description: No explanation of how parallel execution works with isolated agents
issues.fix_suggestion: Add section explaining: 'Each work item is processed by an isolated agent running in its own git worktree. The max_parallel setting controls how many agents run concurrently. Agents execute independently and failures are isolated.' Include simple diagram showing multiple agents processing items in parallel.

issues.description: No guidance on appropriate use cases for MapReduce workflows vs standard workflows
issues.fix_suggestion: Add section with decision guidance: Use MapReduce when: 1) Processing 10+ independent items, 2) Each item takes significant time, 3) Operations can be parallelized safely, 4) You need fault isolation per item. Use standard workflows for: Sequential operations, single-item processing, workflows requiring shared state.

issues.description: No navigation links to related MapReduce documentation pages
issues.fix_suggestion: Add 'Next Steps' or 'Learn More' section with links to: work-distribution.md (work item management), checkpoint-resume.md (state management), dlq.md (error handling), event-tracking.md (monitoring). This helps readers find detailed information.
